title: Ranked meta
body:
Hey guys, just thought I'd pop in and talk about the ranked metas after 5 ranked games today.
Before I say anything, I'll make it clear that I have always been a "casual", preferring to simply have a good time playing my non-meta champions like talon (back over a year ago when he was considered poop-tier champ), Yasuo top and jungle (when he was released), ad taric, mid wukong, heimer (pre-rework) and viktor (pre-rework). As you can see none of my mains exactly follow the meta, and I never had problems with that.

However, since ranked apparently "shows how good you really are", I decided to play a couple of ranked games under the pressure from my friends. I played a few ranked games last year and the experience was not pleasant. I chose talon mid and my entire team flamed me for not picking zed, despite me doing well. I picked yasuo and everyone questioned me, and when I lose first blood to a volibear top, everyone began nitpicking at my mistakes and at how top yasuo sucks. I got fed up so I reverted to normals before my 7 month firewall issue.

Now, I finlly got a new router which enabled me to play lol again, and I decided I wanted to try my hands at ranked again, but the same things happened again. I play wukong mid and everyone flames me because I lost to an ahri. I play heimer top and everyone flames me because I was 1 shot by the enemy shaco that fed off our Warwick.

I feel this is unfair and unjustified. I should have freedom to play whatever cheese pick I choose without being considered a troll. I know that this post is just me ranting but seriously, what happened to everyone's creativity? Everyone should simply play the champions they enjoy playing rather than picking the champion currently most op in the meta, then moving onto the next one once the champ gets nerfed. People say that winning is fun, but playing a champion you don't like just because it will help you win, is that what people consider fun?

Once again, I am sorry for the text wall and the rant, but I feel this issue must be resolved somehow, and I think lol will be a much better place when people can play whatever they want without being flamed at for stupid mistakes. Thanks for reading and have a nice day :)

tl;dr meta is stupid.

replies.body:
> tl;dr meta is stupid.

Couldn't agree more. I love playing Quinn and whenever I pick her in normals I get flamed, even when I do well (sometimes managing to 2 hit enemy tanks). People just think that META is the *only* way to go and not using the META will immediately result in a loss because they're all mindless sheep that can't think of playing for fun. Mind you I am just talking about those who flame people who don't always pick META champs, not necessarily anyone who follows the META.

Meta doesn't exist in bronze


I %%%%ing picked Vlad bot lane and still manage to go 3/0/1 at bot.(normals, but you get the point, meta doesn't exist at low elo)

You missed the point, I am NOT a meta player, and I go around getting 10-1 and stuff with ad taric and mid wukong. The point is, as soon as you fail a game because we are humans and we make errors, everyone begins blaming you for every little small thing. Say that vlad game, if you lost 2 deaths at the start, even if you go like 17-2 late game, chances are you WILL get flamed anyways as soon as you become 17-3.

I skimmed through you wall of text, so i may have missed some points.

its mainly because champs are op at the moment, champs are really weak or another champ can do your role alot better at the same thing. For example, if 2 people at the same elo picked Gnar and Heimer top, id back the Gnar 10/10 times because hes proven to be alot more useful on a daily basis. Having a cheese / off pick is ok... but unless you accept that its probably a dumb move doing it every game unless youre a proven god at that champ.. id stop.

What about sleeper champions? A lot of my champions are very powerful sleepers that enemy do not know how to counter (malzahar, mid wukong, swain, etc.) and as I have said, I have been flamed back last year when I played talon, and despite a very stable score with him, people always found ways to say talon sucked. Now look at him, he gets played once at LCS and suddenly everyone starts playing him and complaining he's op, despite not having a single buff his way in years.

Meta is a thing in high levels, low level players just think it matters.

However the other thing about low level is that it's always someone else's fault, the middle of the blame game is generally the off meta pick cause you did the "wrong thing" from champ select.

They'll get over it, though just as a point, if you can't win against your opponent (whether this is because your blind picking a champ that has lots of counters, or picking straight into a counter) that IS your problem.

My off meta picks (thresh/"Quinn" (some people still seriously call this off meta) top is the only one's i do in ranked) generally win lane all of the time, but that is because they are pocket picks that i choose in a good situation.

Know your champions well enough and off meta picking is fine.

true, and I can say I am very good at most of my off meta picks. However, in the case of to Yasuo, I lost first blood to volibear by around 20 health, and even when I became powerful late game, I was still being nit picked at how top yasuo sucks.

As for my wukong mid, I came to ranked after not playing for a really long time, and fought an ahri, who I had no idea what to do against before I realised I have always dreaded fighting ahri as wukong. By that time, I was already 2 kills behind due to a failed gank where our jarvan pressured me to push which resulted in me being charmed under turret.

I have been playing off meta picks for about as long as I have been playing lol (even my first ever main was heimer) and I am rather good at most of them enough to have a decent ratio. However, I find it unfair that while whenever I win everyone says "gg noobs" or "gg easy" even if they did nothing, and whenever I make a simple mistake everyone immediately goes on me and starts calling me stupid just because I picked a underplayed champ.

They exist, and so does the mute button.

I always get called out in champ select for thresh top, and it's always by the person who ends up feeding.

Mute the tools that don't benefit the team.

The meta doesn't even matter at low levels.

If you lose with an off meta pick, either you're not good enough with that champ and should'nt have picked it or you got outplayed by a better opponent and would've lost no matter what you picked.

The meta has nothing to do with it.

People will pick on literally anything if you make a mistake. I once got hit by a blind blitz hook in my teams jungle and the mid laner starts raving about my build, saying that nobody should ever build Morellonomicon and because I built it I'm the worst player of all time.

The meta is real. It's important. But apparently not until somewhere around plat.

People are stupid.
